questions.question: On a reciprocating engine aeroplane, with increasing altitude at constant gross mass, constant angle of attack and configuration, the power required:

options.content: remains unchanged but the TAS increases
increases and the TAS increases by the same percentage
increases but TAS remains constant
decreases slightly because of the lower air density

questions.question: Moving the centre of gravity from the forward to the aft limit: (gross mass, altitude and airspeed remain unchanged).

options.content: increases the power required
affects neither drag nor power required
increases the induced drag
decreases the induced drag and reduces the power required

questions.question: For jet engine aeroplanes operating below the optimum altitude, what is the effect of increased altitude on specific range?

options.content: It does not change
Increases only if there is no wind
Increases
Decreases

questions.question: If the thrust available exceeds the thrust required for level flight:

options.content: the aeroplane accelerates if the altitude is maintained
the aeroplane descends if the airspeed is maintained
the aeroplane decelerates if it is in the region of reversed command
the aeroplane decelerates if the altitude is maintained

questions.question: Given a jet aircraft, which order of speeds is correct?

options.content: V<sub>S</sub>, Maximum range speed, V<sub>X</sub>
Maximum endurance speed, Maximum range speed, V<sub>X</sub>
V<sub>S</sub>, V<sub>X</sub>, Maximum range speed
Maximum endurance speed, Long range speed, Maximum range speed

questions.question: The pilot of a light twin engine aircraft has calculated a 4000 m service ceiling with a take-off mass of 3250 kg, based on the general forecast conditions for the flight. If the take-off mass is 3000 kg, the service ceiling will be:

options.content: less than 4000 m
unchanged, equal to 4000 m
only a new performance analysis will determine if the service ceiling is higher or lower than 4000 m
higher than 4000 m

questions.question: Consider the graphic representation of the power required for a jet aeroplane versus true airspeed (TAS). When drawing the tangent out of the origin, the point of contact determines the speed of:

options.content: critical angle of attack
maximum endurance
maximum endurance
maximum specific range

questions.question: In the drag versus speed curve for a jet aeroplane, the speed for maximum range corresponds with:

options.content: the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the drag curve
the point of intersection of the parasite drag curve and the induced drag curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the parasite drag curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the induced drag curve

questions.question: The speed V<sub>S</sub> is defined as the:

options.content: speed for best specific range
stalling speed or minimum steady flight speed at which the aeroplane is controllable
safety speed for take-off in case of a contaminated runway
design stress speed

questions.question: What is the effect of a headwind component, compared to still air, on the maximum range speed (IAS) and the speed for maximum climb angle respectively?

options.content: Maximum range speed decreases and maximum climb angle speed decreases
Maximum range speed increases and maximum climb angle speed increases
Maximum range speed increases and maximum climb angle speed stays constant
Maximum range speed decreases and maximum climb angle speed increases

questions.question: A jet aeroplane is flying at the long range cruise speed at the optimum altitude. How does the specific range / fuel flow change over a given time period?

options.content: Decrease / decrease
Increase / decrease
Increase / increase
Decrease / increase

questions.question: The maximum indicated airspeed of a piston engine aeroplane, in level flight, is reached:

options.content: at the service ceiling
at the practical ceiling
at the lowest possible altitude
at the optimum cruise altitude

questions.question: The optimum cruise altitude increases:

options.content: if the aeroplane mass is decreased
if the temperature (OAT) is increased
if the tailwind component is decreased
if the aeroplane mass is increased

questions.question: What effect has a tailwind on the maximum endurance speed?

options.content: No effect
Tailwind only affects holding speed
The IAS will be increased
The IAS will be decreased

questions.question: Which of the equations below defines specific air range (SR)?

options.content: SR = Ground speed/Total Fuel Flow
SR = True Airspeed/Total Fuel Flow
SR = Indicated Airspeed/Total Fuel Flow
SR = Mach Number/Total Fuel Flow

questions.question: Which of the following statements, with regard to the optimum altitude (best fuel mileage), is correct?

options.content: An aeroplane usually flies above the optimum cruise altitude, as this provides the largest specific range
An aeroplane sometimes flies above the optimum cruise altitude, because ATC normally does not allow an aeroplane to fly continuously at the optimum cruise altitude
An aeroplane always flies below the optimum cruise altitude, as otherwise Mach buffet can occur
An aeroplane always flies on the optimum cruise altitude, because this is most attractive from an economy point of view

questions.question: The optimum altitude:

options.content: is the altitude up to which cabin pressure of 8000 ft can be maintained
increases as mass decreases and is the altitude at which the specific range reaches its maximum
decreases as mass decreases
is the altitude at which the specific range reaches its minimum

questions.question: A lower airspeed at constant mass and altitude requires:

options.content: less thrust and a lower coefficient of lift
more thrust and a lower coefficient of lift
more thrust and a lower coefficient of drag
a higher coefficient of lift

questions.question: The point at which a tangent out of the origin touches the power required curve:

options.content: is the point where drag coefficient is a minimum
is the point where the lift to drag ratio is a minimum
is the maximum drag speed
is the point where the lift to drag ratio is a maximum

questions.question: In relation to the speed for maximum range cruise (MRC), the long range cruise speed (LRC) is:

options.content: Lower
Dependent on the OAT and net mass
Dependent on density altitude and mass
Higher

questions.question: The maximum horizontal speed occurs when:

options.content: the thrust is equal to minimum drag
the thrust does not increase further with increasing speed
the maximum thrust is equal to the total drag
the thrust is equal to the maximum drag

questions.question: Under which condition should you fly considerably lower (4000 ft or more) than the optimum altitude?

options.content: If at the lower altitude either more headwind or less tailwind can be expected
If at the lower altitude either considerably less headwind or considerably more tailwind can be expected
If the maximum altitude is below the optimum altitude
If the temperature is lower at the low altitude (high altitude inversion)

questions.question: The optimum cruise altitude is:

options.content: the pressure altitude up to which a cabin altitude of 8000 ft can be maintained
the pressure altitude at which the TAS for high speed buffet is a maximum
the pressure altitude at which the best specific range can be achieved
the pressure altitude at which the fuel flow is a maximum

questions.question: Maximum endurance for a piston engine aeroplane is achieved at:

options.content: the speed that approximately corresponds to the maximum rate of climb speed
the speed for maximum lift coefficient
the speed for minimum drag
the speed that corresponds to the speed for minimum rate of descent

questions.question: On a long distance flight the gross mass decreases continuously as a consequence of the fuel consumption. The result is:

options.content: the speed must be increased to compensate the lower mass
the specific range increases and the optimum altitude decreases
the specific range decreases and the optimum altitude increases
the specific range and the optimum altitude increase

questions.question: A jet aeroplane is climbing at constant Mach number below the tropopause. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.content: IAS decreases and TAS decreases
IAS increases and TAS increases
IAS decreases and TAS increases
IAS increases and TAS decreases

questions.question: Why are ˋstep climbsˊ used on long distance flights?

options.content: Step climbs do not have any special purpose for jet aeroplanes; they are used for piston engine aeroplanes only
ATC do not permit cruise climbs
To fly as close as possible to the optimum altitude as aeroplane mass reduces
Step climbs are only justified if at the higher altitude less headwind or more tailwind can be expected

questions.question: Which of the following sequences of speed for a jet aeroplane is correct? (From low to high speeds.)

options.content: Maximum endurance speed, maximum range speed, maximum angle of climb speed
Maximum endurance speed, long range speed, maximum range speed
V<sub>S</sub>, maximum angle climb speed, maximum range speed
V<sub>S</sub>, maximum range speed, maximum angle climb speed

questions.question: The pilot of a jet aeroplane wants to use a minimum amount of fuel between two airfields. Which flight procedure should the pilot fly?

options.content: Maximum endurance
Holding
Long range
Maximum range

questions.question: Long range cruise is selected as:

options.content: the higher speed to achieve 99% of maximum specific range in zero wind
the speed for best economy (ECON)
the climbing cruise with one or two engines inoperative
specific range with tailwind

questions.question: The optimum long range cruise altitude for a turbojet aeroplane:

options.content: is only dependent on the outside air temperature
increases when the aeroplane mass decreases
is always equal to the powerplant ceiling
is independent of the aeroplane mas

questions.question: Maximum endurance:

options.content: is the same as maximum specific range with wind correction
can be flown in a steady climb only
can be reached with the ˋbest rate of climbˊ speed in level flight
is achieved in unaccelerated level flight with minimum fuel consumption

questions.question: For a piston engine aeroplane, the speed for maximum range is:

options.content: that which gives the maximum lift to drag ratio
that which gives the minimum value of power
that which gives the maximum value of lift
1.4 times the stall speed in clean configuration

questions.question: The speed for maximum endurance:

options.content: is always higher than the speed for maximum specific range
is always lower than the speed for maximum specific range
is the lower speed to achieve 99% of maximum specific range
can either be higher or lower than the speed for maximum specific range

questions.question: The intersections of the thrust available and the drag curves are the operating points of the aeroplane:

options.content: in unaccelerated climb
in unaccelerated level flight
in descent with constant IAS
in accelerated level flight

questions.question: For a jet transport aeroplane, which of the following is the reason for the use of ˋmaximum range speedˊ?

options.content: Minimizes specific fuel consumption
Minimizes fuel flow for a given distance
Longest flight duration
Minimizes drag

questions.question: The centre of gravity moving near to, but still within, the aft limit:

options.content: increases the stalling speed
improves the longitudinal stability
decreases the maximum range
improves the maximum range

questions.question: A jet aeroplane is performing a maximum range flight. The speed corresponds to:

options.content: the minimum drag
the minimum required power
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the power required versus TAS curve
the point of contact of the tangent from the origin to the Drag versus TAS curve

questions.question: During a cruise flight of a jet aeroplane at a constant flight level and at the maximum range speed, the IAS / the drag will:

options.content: increase / increase
decrease / increase
decrease / decrease
increase / decrease

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason to operate an aeroplane at ˋlong range speedˊ?

options.content: The aircraft can be operated close to the buffet onset speed
In order to prevent loss of speed stability and tuck-under
It offers greatly reduced time costs than with maximum range speed
In order to achieve speed stability

questions.question: Long range cruise is a flight procedure which gives:

options.content: an IAS which is 1% higher than the IAS for maximum specific range
a specific range which is 99% of maximum specific range and a lower cruise speed
a specific range which is about 99% of maximum specific range and higher cruise speed
a 1% higher TAS for maximum specific range

questions.question: The lowest point of the drag or thrust required curve of a jet aeroplane is the point for:

options.content: minimum drag and maximum endurance
maximum specific range and minimum power
minimum power
minimum specific range

questions.question: If other factors are unchanged, the fuel mileage or range (nautical miles per kg) is:

options.content: independent of the centre of gravity position
lower with an aft centre of gravity position
higher with a forward centre of gravity position
lower with a forward centre of gravity position

questions.question: To achieve the maximum range over ground with headwind the airspeed should be:

options.content: lower compared to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind
reduced to the gust penetration speed
higher compared to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind
equal to the speed for maximum range cruise with no wind

questions.question: When utilizing the step climb technique, one should wait for the weight reduction, from fuel burn, to result in:

options.content: the aerodynamic ceiling to increase by approximately 2000 ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4000 ft higher
the optimum altitude to increase by approximately 2000 ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4000 ft higher
the manoeuvre ceiling to increase by approximately 2000 ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4000 ft higher
the en route ceiling to increase by approximately 2000 ft above the present altitude, whereby one would climb approximately 4000 ft higher

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true regarding the performance of an aeroplane in level flight?

options.content: The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the maximum power available from the engine
The minimum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the maximum power available from the engine
The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the minimum power available from the engine
The maximum level flight speed will be obtained when the power required equals the power available from the engine
